thread.title_full: Mid-America Windmill Museum seeks donations to fix machines

title: Mid-America Windmill Museum seeks donations to fix machines
text:
Mid-America Windmill Museum in NE Indiana seeks $50K in donations to fix machines in disrepair 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 8/2/15 2:35 pm EDT - Updated: 8/2/15 2:35 pm EDT 
KENDALLVILLE, Indiana â€” The Mid-America Windmill Museum in northeastern Indiana is seeking donations to restore its 53 machines before they completely break down. 
The News-Sun reports ( http://bit.ly/1ISjzDD ) the museum in Kendallville, about 25 miles northwest of Fort Wayne, has 53 restored windmills, making it the nation's largest collection of historic windmills east of the Mississippi River. However, museum President Christine Howard says more than half of them are in various states of disrepair, and it has hired an expert to spend three days per week repairing them. 
Board President Tom Burke says the museum has received a $50,000 matching grant that could double the size of donations. He says gifts of at least $1,000 will be rewarded with a placard on a windmill with the donor's name. 
Information from: The News-Sun, http://www.kpcnews.com
